title: Large-Scale 4C/ID Model-Based Dental Education Course for Improving Clinical Reasoning and Scientific Inquiry Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary dental science knowledge, comprehension of patient care procedures, and basic competency in scientific methodology (experiment design and data analysis)
context.additional_context: An educational process where medium-sized learner groups repeatedly perform tasks resembling actual clinical scenarios in constrained technological environments (no PC access, smartphone-based), receiving feedback. Learners experience the scientific inquiry process through observational recording, symptom analysis, and treatment outcome measurement.

learning_goals: Learners apply systematic clinical reasoning processes with 80% accuracy in situations similar to actual dental cases and establish diagnostic hypotheses based on scientific evidence.
Learners can decompose complex cases into three stages (observation-hypothesis formulation-variable analysis) and utilize strategies to manage cognitive load.
Learners correct at least 70% of their clinical judgment errors based on peer evaluations and instructor feedback and propose new treatment protocols through error analysis.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
